Class FileIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileIO

  • public class FileIO
extends java.lang.Object
    The class that handles all the loading in of files from the file system.
    Author:
    Dale Peters (dmp9@aber.ac.uk)

        public FileIO()

    • Method Detail

      • readFile

        public void readFile(java.lang.String fileName,
            java.lang.String mode)
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads the two files specified by the user in to the program so that the algorithm can be carried out.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file the user wishes to read in, passed in by the command line arguments args[0] and args[1].
        mode - The way in which the program decides which variable to store the grid in. If it is "initial", it will store it in the startState variable. If it is "target", it will store it in the targetState variable.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • getStartState

        public GridState getStartState()
        Returns the starting state of the puzzle to be solved.
        Returns:
        the starting state of the puzzle to be solved.

      • getTargetState

        public GridState getTargetState()
        Returns the state of the puzzle the algorithm is to try and get to in order to solve the puzzle.
